course_title: Special Topics: Political Science: State Politics and Policy
class_notes: State governments have significant influence on public policies that affect the well-being of citizens and the places in which they live. This course provides an introduction to politics and policymaking in the American states with a focus on institutions (federalism, elections and voter participation, political parties, interest groups, governors, legislators, and the courts) and the adoption of public policies as well as how those policies affect citizens differently depending on where they live. Our examination of state policymaking will be drawn from a broad range of policy areas including health, education and training, welfare, housing, economic development, transportation, the environment, and fiscal policy, among others.
course_description: Selected topics and problems in political science. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
